page.title: 14THE RAILWAY AND KILROOT HALT
page.content: The Railway and Kilroot Halt The single track line which passes through the area runs from Belfast to Whitehead and Larne. Kilroot Halt, which has been closed now for some ten years, served the immediate community for many years as a concessionary halt. Beside the station a level crossing gave access to Rosganna Manor, a large Victorian Mansion, which was demolished in the 1970's to make way for Kilroot Power Station. The line, opened in the 1920's as the L.M.S. to facilitate tourists to Whitehead, Blackhead, The Gobbins, Browns Bay, Portmuck and Larne has changed its name through the U.T.A. to "Northern Ireland Railways" is now mainly a commuter line for people living in Whitehead and Carrickfergus and working in Belfast.
